Miguel López acaba el juicio por el asesinato de su suegra sin decir "nada"
Su abogado ha tratado de desmontar las tesis de las acusaciones con el argumento de que no hay pruebas directas y ha afirmado que "cuando equivocas la investigación desde el principio no puede salir nada bien". También ha añadido que su defendido era "de los que mejor se llevaba con María del Carmen"
06 Nov 2019, 19:43 by informacion.es
El yerno y único acusado del crimen a tiros de la viuda del expresidente de Caja Mediterráneo (CAM) Vicente Sala, Miguel López, se ha limitado a señalar que "nada, muchas gracias" al ser preguntado por la magistrada si quería hacer uso de su derecho a la última palabra antes del veredicto.
"Nada, muchas gracias", ha contestado a la presidenta del tribunal que le ha trasladado la posibilidad antes de dar por concluido el juicio por el crimen de María del Carmen Martínez, cometido el 9 de diciembre de 2016 en el lavadero del concesionario de coches que regentaba López.
Así ha sido al término de una maratoniana sesión de casi ocho horas en la que las acusaciones de la fiscalía y la particular y su defensa han presentado sus conclusiones finales en la decimoséptima y última sesión del juicio con jurado popular en la Audiencia Provincial de Alicante.
El rechazo a la posibilidad de dirigirse a las seis mujeres y tres hombres del jurado se ha producido después de que, durante dos horas y media, su abogado, Javier Sánchez-Vera, haya tratado de desmontar las tesis de las acusaciones, con el argumento de que no hay pruebas directas ni siquiera indicios contra su defendido sino que en las últimas semanas se ha demostrado una investigación policial "equivocada".
En un alegato de unas dos horas, el letrado ha afirmado que "cuando equivocas la investigación desde el principio no puede salir nada bien" y ha añadido que su defendido, Miguel López, era "de los que mejor se llevaba con María del Carmen (Martínez), aunque se diga lo contrario".
Ha insistido en que la investigación policial no ha sido "correcta" porque ha "sustituido la prueba científica por suposiciones", lo que conduce a "errores judiciales clarísimos", en caso de que su defendido resultara considerado culpable con unas acusaciones que le piden hasta 24 años de prisión.
Las conversaciones de Miguel López recogidas en el caso Sala
"Me da una pena que te cagas, no por mi suegra sino por la situación"



"Mi suegra era una mujer muy volátil. Hoy era blanco, mañana negro"



"Vicente es actor profesional. Nunca nos informaba de los negocios en Latinoamérica"



Fany Sala a su hijo:"Eres gilipollas. Era mi madre y era tu abuela"
text:
Miguel López ends the trial for the murder of his mother-in-law without saying "nothing"
His lawyer has tried to dismantle the thesis of the accusations with the argument that there is no direct evidence and has affirmed that "when you mislead the investigation from the beginning, nothing can go well." He also added that his defendant was "one of those who best got along with María del Carmen"
06 Nov 2019, 19:43 by informacion.es
The son-in-law and the only one accused of the shooting crime of the widow of the former president of Caja Mediterráneo (CAM) Vicente Sala, Miguel López, has simply said that "nothing, thank you very much" when asked by the magistrate if he wanted to use his right to the last word before the verdict.
"Nothing, thank you very much," he replied to the president of the court that he has transferred the possibility before concluding the trial for the crime of María del Carmen Martínez, committed on December 9, 2016 in the car dealership laundry Lopez ran.
Thus it has been at the end of a marathon session of almost eight hours in which the accusations of the prosecutor and the private individual and his defense have presented their final conclusions at the seventeenth and last session of the jury trial at the Provincial Court of Alicante.
The rejection of the possibility of addressing the six women and three men of the jury came after, for two and a half hours, his lawyer, Javier Sánchez-Vera, tried to dismantle the theses of the accusations, with the argument that there is no direct evidence or even evidence against his defendant but that in recent weeks a "wrong" police investigation has been demonstrated.
In an allegation of about two hours, the lawyer has affirmed that "when you make a mistake from the beginning, nothing can go well" and added that his defendant, Miguel López, was "one of those who best got along with María del Carmen ( Martínez), even if the opposite is said. "
He has insisted that the police investigation has not been "correct" because he has "replaced the scientific evidence with assumptions", which leads to "very clear judicial errors", in case his defendant was found guilty with accusations that ask him until 24 years in prison
Miguel López's conversations included in the Sala case
"I feel sorry that you screw up, not because of my mother-in-law but because of the situation"



"My mother-in-law was a very volatile woman. Today she was white, tomorrow black"



"Vicente is a professional actor. He never informed us of business in Latin America"



Fany Sala to his son: "You're an asshole. He was my mother and he was your grandmother."
